column4: Sorry, I'm not clear on your question. Do you need help moving the package to the computer, or finding the package?
if the former, why not use a usb thumb drive?
i found the package, i need help installing it since the machine doesn't seem to let me do it.
can you give me a more precise error message?
i have it on a 12.04 Cd
so L3top came back to help now, thx
I have totally tuned out. Can you re-ask with a summary of what you tried? Maybe copy the converstation into a pastebin?
So to summarize: You can see the package, but it is asking you to download more files, which you cannot do, because your internet isn't working yet?
basically yeah. and also the system doesn't grant me access to install the files on the cd - which i suppose should be enough to install the package. at least according to the ubuntu documentation
Are you doing all this from the liveCD too?
no, i just recently loaded the livCD
So it doesn't work on the install ubuntu either.
installed (as in, booted from the HDD)
it doesn't work from the install either. the only thing i tried from the liveCD was sudo fsck -f /dev/sda1
I am stumped then. The only suggestion I can offer is to grab the package you need on another computer and copy it over with a flash drive.
the weirdest thing is that it says access denied when i am doing a sudo command. Well I do have the package and the file, but on the liveCD.
